text:
🚀 What We Look for in Startups at LvlUp Ventures 🚀
(From the investor’s perspective)

At LvlUp Ventures, we back Seed-stage startups that are bold enough to think differently—and scrappy enough to make it happen.

Here’s what stands out to us when reviewing new opportunities:

✅ Clear Problem & Unique Insight
Startups that truly understand the pain point they're solving and bring a fresh, founder-led perspective to the table.

✅ Early Signs of Traction
This doesn't have to be sky-high revenue—but strong signals like user retention, organic growth, partnerships or early sales channels working well.

✅ A Sharp, Coachable Team
We love founders who are relentless and receptive. You're the expert in your domain—but open to strategic collaboration.

✅ Capital Efficiency
We’re big believers in doing more with less. Efficient execution and thoughtful resource allocation go a long way in this market.

✅ Platform Potential
Can this product evolve into something bigger? We get excited by businesses with real ecosystem or category-defining potential.

Our team rolls up its sleeves post-investment—we don’t just write checks, we help you grow through partnerships, channel support, and deep founder-in-residence experience.

If you're building something bold, we’d love to hear from you.

Otherwise Brewing is extremely pleased to announce that LvlUp Ventures and SHOPLINE have joined our follow-on round as the first #investment in their new #CPG Fund.

Over the past couple of weeks I’ve been working closely with the LvlUp and Shopline teams, and they’ve been amazing strategic partners—willing to move fast, brimming with valuable advice, and generous with introductions and connections.

They were particularly drawn to Otherwise’s #eCommerce business, and we look forward to tapping their expertise to supercharge this revenue channel. 

For most breweries, #D2C sales are an afterthought, given the challenges of alcohol shipping and the ubiquity of local #craftbeer. It’s different for gluten-free, however, since many consumers lack local #GlutenFreeBeer options. 

Ever since we launched, we would receive emails from consumers asking us if we could ship our beer to them out of state. It’s been about 18 months since we started national eCommerce, and the reception has been explosive. With Shopline and LvlUp, we look forward to “leveling up” and extending this hockey stick growth to even greater heights.

🚀 Why 2025 Might Be the Best Time in a Decade to Build a CPG Brand

With all the talk about rising costs, tighter capital, and DTC struggles—it might seem like the odds are stacked against emerging CPG brands. But under the surface, there's something exciting happening:

🔹 Retail buyers are hungry for innovative indie products that build loyalty and drive growth in a saturated aisle.
🔹 Strategic acquirers are back—2024 saw a ~20% YoY increase in M&A activity in food & beverage, especially in better-for-you and premium segments.
🔹 Community-led brands are thriving on platforms like TikTok, where 67% of Gen Z say they discover new CPG products.
🔹 Capital is still flowing, but it’s flowing smarter—investors are favoring capital-efficient operators with strong gross margins and clear paths to profitability.

💡 If you’re a founder building with a focus on retail strategy, product velocity, and community, you might be more “VC-backable” than you think.

text:
🚨 Startups, VCs, and the Tariff Tension: What Now? 🚨

President Trump’s newly reimposed tariffs are shaking markets, prompting a deeper question: What does this mean for startups and venture capital?

📉 The Bad News:

Nasdaq is rattled — with tech giants like NVIDIA and Tesla dropping double digits.

Klarna and StubHub postponed IPOs due to valuation pressure and uncertainty.

VCs are jittery. Theory Ventures' Tomasz Tunguz warned of a funding slowdown: “No exits = no returns = no new funds.”

📈 The (Possible) Silver Lining:

Some sectors — like #AI — are seeing more investor attention. Andreessen Horowitz is reportedly raising a $20B megafund focused on U.S. growth-stage AI.

Multinational giants like TSMC, Intel Corporation, and Samsung Electronics have committed to pouring hundreds of billions of dollars into U.S.-based fabs and advanced manufacturing, potentially creating downstream opportunities for startups in #semiconductors, #robotics, #cleantech, and #logistics.

Tariff-induced instability might spur innovation, local #manufacturing, and startup diversification — long-term positives for resilient founders.

💬 But here’s the real question: Are these tariffs a bargaining chip? Will we see them lifted or selectively reduced as leverage in future negotiations — especially with key allies and trade partners? Could this be temporary noise, or the start of a prolonged recalibration of the global startup landscape?

#startups #venturecapital #trump #tariffs #IPO #VCfunding #AI #a16z #economy #innovation #vc #startup

Stay tuned as we scale globally and transform how businesses engage with customers!

text:
Founders keep telling me they’re “too early” for VCs 👀 

But more often than not, it’s not the stage that’s the problem — it’s the story.

Investors don’t need millions in revenue.
We need to believe you’re the one to build something big.

When Airbnb was pitching, most investors passed.
The idea sounded niche. Couch-surfing for conferences? Really?

But they reframed it:
“People are already doing this — they’re just doing it in untrustworthy, fragmented ways. We’re building the trusted platform.”

They showed a vision that was WAY bigger than a few air mattresses.
They made the early traction feel inevitable.
They made the pain point obvious.

Suddenly, the “too early” startup became a rocketship 🚀 

Here’s the truth:
You’re not too early.
You just haven’t told a story that makes your future feel inevitable.

If you’re a founder in that zone, I want to hear your pitch.
Even if you only have 20 users.

👇  Apply Here (We Meet With Every Founder) 👇 
🔗 https://lnkd.in/e3tnQh9G

text:
The future of AI and National Artificial Intelligence Association members’ influence on it:

In my view, Artificial Intelligence is an almost limitless technology which, within the next three to five years will have the ability to entirely revolutionize the way we live and work. 

This is already proving to be the case, with large enterprises instituting hiring freezes on new talent due to the efficiencies of AI, and startups in our LvlUp Ventures portfolio creating entire platforms in days with zero software developers.

Within the next three years, I believe that AI will put us at an inflection point including such questions as: do we let AI have the capability to soon replace the majority of the workforce? Do we allow AI access sensitive to data for medical treatment development? Do we permit AI to deeply assist in war fighting?

People & governments around the world will be faced with the need to make decisions including on the issues above.

Currently, the Trump administration is rightfully advocating for strong investment & development in AI. That is largely due to the promise it contains for global competitiveness and the American economy. In just a couple of years, that will likely be a very different situation, as AI advancements will set the stage for the loss of potential jobs, cyber & biological threats, and more.

The National Artificial Intelligence Association, quickly becoming one of the largest technology coalitions in the country, is primed to ensure that the American people, government, and the world at large are able to make the right decisions before, during, and after these times in order to unleash American ingenuity and decide on what the “fine line” is for Artificial Intellifence and its impact on society: limited or limitless integration; work or home; unfettered growth; or an entirely different approach.

#AI #technology #regulation #US #Globe

BIDEN ISSUES EO ON AI INFRASTRUCTURE

President Biden has signed the Executive Order (below link) entitled "Advancing US Leadership in Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure".  The Biden Administration also released a 165-page "Interim Final Rule on AI diffusion".  (See separate post on the Rule).  The recent "NAIA Digest: AI in Washington" relayed of this upcoming, last minute Biden Administration AI plans to limit AI chip exports while enhancing the USA's computing capacity.

Some policies of note in this Executive Order and be aware since this is not a Congressional passed law, President Trump's Administration can reverse all or parts of the EO.

This Executive Order will direct the Department of Defense and the Department of Energy to lease federal sites where the private sector can build frontier AI infrastructure at speed and scale.... Some of this new capacity will also be committed for use by small businesses and startups. Emphasis on clean energy production, accelerate approvals, and no impact on consumer electricity costs.

More details on the AI industry reaction in the next NAIA Digest.

The National Artificial Intelligence Association (NAIA) has been formed.

The NAIA is a non-profit trade association based in Washington, D.C., aiming to promote innovation and global competitiveness for American AI startups and companies.

Aaron Golbin, Co-Chair of NAIA, said that it's important for AI companies to have a voice in Washington as new policies are discussed.

The association offers free and paid memberships and will work with policymakers to ensure AI regulations don't hinder U.S. leadership in AI.

text:
I am very proud to announce the launch of the National Artificial Intelligence Association (thenaia.org) this morning, and my role as Co-Founder and Co-Chair.

NAIA has a single, powerful mission: to ensure unparalleled innovation, opportunities, and global competitiveness for American startups and enterprises building in AI. The trade association will be the leading voice for the AI industry in Washington, already garnering the support of many on the Hill.

As the 119th Congress and the new Trump Administration tackle numerous policy issues related to the rapid application of artificial intelligence to a broad number of industries, it will be key that AI companies have a voice at the table. 

NAIA will work with our policy makers in Washington and on the State governments level to ensure that AI-related regulations do not impede keeping our country in the important global leadership position.

Memberships are now open, join us today to help ensure American leadership in AI — and the success of our innovation economy.

I’m pleased to be working alongside political veterans & experts including Ron Wright, Caleb Max, and Tim Parrish. NAIA is also partnered with LvlUp Ventures, where I serve as Managing Partner, to provide access to NAIA to the thousands of startups applying to the firm annually.

text:
🌟 Portfolio Company Spotlight: Ascendia AI 🌟

🚀 Revolutionizing Mental Health Diagnostics: Using proprietary, AI-powered speech analysis, Ascendia AI transforms how mental health disorders are detected and managed. In just 5 minutes, their non-invasive evaluation analyzes 50+ vocal biomarkers, rigorously validated by over 30 years of research. Trained on a robust dataset of 17,000 clinical hours, this technology provides precise assessments across the DSM-5 spectrum, identifying primary, secondary, and even subclinical conditions for early intervention.

💡 Why It Matters: Mental health care lags 24% behind physical health care in treatment efficacy. Ascendia AI bridges this gap by empowering care providers across all disciplines—not just mental health professionals—with data-driven tools that enhance early detection, personalized treatment, and ongoing progress tracking.

📈 Game-Changing Integration: Ascendia AI seamlessly integrates into existing systems, elevating care standards across organizations and platforms. Their approach sets a new benchmark for precision and personalization in mental healthcare, driving better outcomes for patients worldwide.

We’re excited to support Ascendia AI on their mission to revolutionize mental health diagnostics and care!

text:
Introducing Hello Near Me
Over a decade of travelling together (and we are still married!).
20+ countries and counting.
Hundreds of amazing local experiences. 
Thousands of hours searching and countless local recommendations.

No matter your destination, the experience is always the same.
It’s the locals that make travelling so rewarding.

From the welcoming hotel concierge to the hospitable Airbnb host, from the timeless flavors of a family-owned eatery to the young upstart baker crafting a fresh take out of old recipes.

The excitement of a sports game with tens of thousands of local fans or the thrill of discovering an upcoming band playing at the back of the dive bar, with 30 other locals that were mostly there for the hot wings challenge! (which I reckon I could have won).

We are on a mission to celebrate these local experiences and connect as many travellers as possible to them.

So next time you travel, go and say hello.
Join us at hellonearme.com

If you are a hotel, Airbnb host or local business that wants to elevate the traveller's experience.
Please reach out.

text: Huge milestone for the entire LvlUp Ventures & NextUp Accelerators and Incubators team! Excited to work with the leadership and board at Arax Holdings Corp. to take the enterprise to the next level! Special thanks to Jacob Ringel who led this deal.

author.headline: Managing Partner at LvlUp Ventures | Co-Founder & Co-Chairman, National Artificial Intelligence Association | VC, Startups, Investor | 4x Forbes

posted_at.relative: 7 months ago • Edited • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

reshared_post.text:
We are beyond excited to announce the entrance of Arax Holdings Corp. (Stock Ticker: ARAT), a leading $150M Blockchain-As-A-Platform (BaaP) company, into the NextUp Scale by LvlUp Ventures Accelerator Portfolio.

ARAX is pioneering game-changing blockchain infrastructure technologies with clients and/or applications across financial services, government, consumer goods, and more. The company holds numerous patents pertaining to the future of blockchain and its application for organizations.

Aaron Golbin and Brandon Maier will be the lead advisors for ARAX Holdings on behalf of LvlUp Ventures as part of this transformational effort.

This addition marks a 🚀 new milestone in LvlUp Ventures’ first-of-its-kind NextUp Scale Accelerator, strategically supporting both (1) private & (2) public technology startups and enterprises in scaling to the next level through a bespoke, expert, and ecosystem-applied approach. Leveraging our core team of VC’s, institutional investors, and seasoned operators, we aim to help ARAX unlock its full potential and make a big impact on the way enterprises can more effectively function.

Learn more about ARAX at arax.cc.
